description: Sixteen departments have been placed on red alert, the highest level of warning, and 68 on orange alert as France faces the peak of a lengthy heatwave, which has already lasted 13 days.

description: The Israeli strike that targeted a seaside café frequented by Gaza's intellectuals on Monday left dozens dead and wounded.

headline: Heatwave claims several victims in southern Europe
description: Two deaths in Spain have reignited concerns about worker protection during heatwaves. A construction worker also died in Italy.

headline: Complaint filed against two French-Israeli soldiers accused of war crimes in Gaza
description: The French complaint was lodged by a number of associations defending human rights and supporting Palestinians. It is based primarily on a report by an independent Palestinian journalist.

headline: Israel limits entry of baby formula in Gaza as infants die of hunger
description: While waiting to enter Gaza on a medical aid mission, an American doctor watched Israeli security forces confiscate the cans of powdered baby formula packed in his luggage. The vital product is desperately lacking in the Palestinian enclave, where about 50 children have died of hunger since March.

description: Although long considered the best-protected city in Ukraine, the capital has not been spared from a surge in bombardments now affecting the entire country.

headline: 'Queer people have always existed in the countryside': The spread of Pride marches beyond France's big cities
description: After years of LGBTQIA+ activism being concentrated in bigger French cities, more and more rural Pride events are emerging, from small villages to mid-sized towns. Le Monde spoke with several organizations involved in this movement.

headline: In France, workplaces confront resurgence in machoism
description: Everyday sexism persists among employees and companies continue to perpetuate values tied to male dominance. Yet company leadership has not shifted away from diversity policies, unlike some of their American counterparts.
